## Live Site

 The `master` branch is automatically deployed live when updated (via Netlify): [Live Site](https://determined-raman-df6277.netlify.com)

## Summary

### Why I built this

I built this tool initially because I wanted to know how things were looking day-to-day with the changes in growth rate of confirmed cases. Rather than focusing on big numbers getting bigger, I feel it's more interesting and productive to look at how quickly (or slowly) those numbers are growing.

### Technology

I've been meaning to try out Svelte, and this seemed like a good time to learn. It's a great framework!

- [ ] TODO: Write blog post about experience with Svelte and link here

## Usage

### Online

The best way to use this tool is online via the [Live Site](https://determined-raman-df6277.netlify.com).

### Locally

If you prefer to use it locally, first clone the repo.

*FYI: Even locally, you won't be able to do much without internet unless you modify the API fetch calls to point at local data.*

If you want to use hot reloading, create a dev build:

```bash
npm run dev
```

If you don't plan on changing the code as you use the site, the compiled version is better (this, of course, is what's deployed online):

```bash
npm run build
npm run start
```

By default, both `npm run dev` and `npm run start` will create a server on `localhost:5000`, though rollup will automaticlaly use a different port if 5000 is taken -- check the response in terminal to see the address.

## License

You're free to do whatever you want with this project via the [Unlicense](https://github.com/imjoshellis/covid-curves/blob/develop/LICENSE).

Forks, clones, downloads, and copy/pastes are all welcome & encouraged.

## Built with Svelte

This project was built using the basic template for [Svelte](https://svelte.dev) apps. That template is available on Github at [sveltejs/template](https://github.com/sveltejs/template)
